Mobiles.Name: kitten
Mobiles.Long_Description: A small loyal kitten is here.
Mobiles.Description: The kitten looks like a cute, little, fierce fighter.

Mobiles.Name: puppy
Mobiles.Long_Description: A small loyal puppy is here.
Mobiles.Description: The puppy looks like a cute, little, fierce fighter.

Mobiles.Name: beagle
Mobiles.Long_Description: A small, quick, loyal beagle is here.
Mobiles.Description: The beagle looks like a fierce fighter.

Mobiles.Name: rottweiler
Mobiles.Long_Description: A large, loyal rottweiler is here.
Mobiles.Description: The rottweiler looks like a strong, fierce fighter.

Mobiles.Name: wolf
Mobiles.Long_Description: A large, trained wolf is here.
Mobiles.Description: The wolf looks like a strong, fearless fighter.

Mobiles.Name: maid
Mobiles.Long_Description: The maid is waiting for your order.
Mobiles.Description:
She is very beautiful with golden hair, and deep blue eyes. A good reason
for coming here more often.

Mobiles.Name: sexton
Mobiles.Long_Description: A sexton is sitting here, drinking hot tea.
Mobiles.Description: The sexton looks like he is relaxing after another grave-digging job.

Mobiles.Name: swan
Mobiles.Long_Description: A swan is swimming around in the pond.
Mobiles.Description: The white swan is very elegant.

Mobiles.Name: duckling
Mobiles.Long_Description: A duckling is swimming around in the pond.
Mobiles.Description: The duckling is adorable, it looks most of all like a tiny furball.

Mobiles.Name: sparrow
Mobiles.Long_Description: A sparrow is flapping around on the ground.
Mobiles.Description: The sparrow looks like it is enjoying life.

Mobiles.Name: duck
Mobiles.Long_Description: A duck is here, quacking happily.
Mobiles.Description: The duck is quite fat.  It looks like it is enjoying life.

Mobiles.Name: captain
Mobiles.Long_Description: The captain of the guard is looking very upset.
Mobiles.Description: A big, strong, angry captain.

Mobiles.Name: cityguard guard
Mobiles.Long_Description: A cityguard stands here, looking very upset.
Mobiles.Description: A big, strong, angry guard.

Mobiles.Name: secretary
Mobiles.Long_Description: A secretary is sitting at the desk.
Mobiles.Description:
She looks very busy.
The Secretary says 'Sorry, but the Mayor is extremely busy today'.
The Secretary says 'Please sit down and have a seat in the meantime'.

Mobiles.Name: mayor
Mobiles.Long_Description: The mayor is here.  He shakes your hand.
Mobiles.Description: He is a stocky, middle-aged man with thin, grey hair.

Mobiles.Name: crier
Mobiles.Long_Description: The town crier is here, weeping quietly.
Mobiles.Description: He is very good at his job - completely dissolved in tears.

Mobiles.Name: wizard
Mobiles.Long_Description: A wizard walks around behind the counter, talking to himself.
Mobiles.Description:
The wizard looks old and senile, and yet he looks like a very powerful
wizard. He is equipped with fine clothing, and is wearing many fine
rings and bracelets.

Mobiles.Name: baker
Mobiles.Long_Description: The baker looks at you calmly, wiping flour from his face with one hand.
Mobiles.Description:
A fat, nice looking baker. But you can see that he has many scars on his
body.

Mobiles.Name: grocer
Mobiles.Long_Description: A grocer stands at the counter, with a slightly impatient look on his face.
Mobiles.Description: A tall grocer, who moves two 200 pound bags of flour around on his shoulders.

Mobiles.Name: weaponsmith
Mobiles.Long_Description: A weaponsmith.
Mobiles.Description: A young weaponsmith, who still has lots to learn.

Mobiles.Name: armourer armorer
Mobiles.Long_Description: An armourer stands here.
Mobiles.Description:
An old but very strong armourer, he has made more armours in his
lifetime than you have ever seen.

Mobiles.Name: thief
Mobiles.Long_Description: A thief, all dressed in black.
Mobiles.Description: Well COUNT your money!

Mobiles.Name: captain
Mobiles.Long_Description: A retired captain stands here, selling boats.
Mobiles.Description: This captain has killed more sharks than you have eaten peas.

Mobiles.Name: sailor
Mobiles.Long_Description: A sailor stands here, waiting to train you.
Mobiles.Description: He looks like a strong, fit sailor.

Mobiles.Name: boy
Mobiles.Long_Description: A pet shop boy is here, humming gently.
Mobiles.Description: He is young and close-cropped and looks quite happy.

Mobiles.Name: jeweller
Mobiles.Long_Description: The jeweller is standing behind the desk.
Mobiles.Description: He is fat and has a content although watchful look on his face.

Mobiles.Name: leather worker
Mobiles.Long_Description: The leather worker is sitting by the table, sewing a leather cap.
Mobiles.Description:
He looks as an honest, hard-working artisan who only just earns enough to
keep himself going.

Mobiles.Name: executioner
Mobiles.Long_Description: The executioner is here polishing his blade.
Mobiles.Description:
A masked man with muscles bulging all over his body.  You can tell by
the look in his eyes that he enjoys seeing you cower in his presence.

Mobiles.Name: healer
Mobiles.Long_Description: A healer is here.
Mobiles.Description: Although retired from adventuring, the healer still lends a hand.

Mobiles.Name: guildmaster master
Mobiles.Long_Description: Your guildmaster is standing here.
Mobiles.Description:
Even though your guildmaster looks old and tired, you can clearly see the
vast amount of knowledge she possesses. She is wearing fine magic clothing,
and you notice that she is surrounded by a blue shimmering aura.

Mobiles.Name: guildmaster master
Mobiles.Long_Description: Your guildmaster is standing here.
Mobiles.Description:
You are in no doubt that this guildmaster is truly close to your god; he has
a peaceful, loving look. You notice that he is surrounded by a white aura.

Mobiles.Name: guildmaster master
Mobiles.Long_Description: Your guildmaster is standing here.
Mobiles.Description:
You realize that whenever your guildmaster moves, you fail to notice it:
the way of the true thief.  She is dressed in poor clothing, having
the appearance of a beggar.

Mobiles.Name: guildmaster master
Mobiles.Long_Description: Your guildmaster is standing here.
Mobiles.Description:
This is your master.  Big and strong with bulging muscles.  Several scars
across his body prove that he was using arms before you were born.  He
has a calm look on his face.

Mobiles.Name: sorcerer
Mobiles.Long_Description: A sorcerer is guarding the entrance.
Mobiles.Description:
He is an experienced mage who has specialized in the field of Combat Magic.
He is here to guard the Mage's Guild and his superior knowledge of offensive
as well as defensive spells make him a deadly opponent.

Mobiles.Name: templar
Mobiles.Long_Description: A knight templar is guarding the entrance.
Mobiles.Description:
He is a specially trained warrior belonging to the military order of the Faith.
His duty is to protect the faithful from persecution and infidel attacks and
his religious devotion combined with his superior skill makes him a deadly
opponent.

Mobiles.Name: assassin
Mobiles.Long_Description: An assassin is guarding the entrance.
Mobiles.Description:
He is a thief who has specialized in killing others as effectively as possible,
using all sorts of weapons.  His superior knowledge of how and where to use
them combined with his extraordinary stealth makes him a deadly opponent.

Mobiles.Name: knight
Mobiles.Long_Description: A knight is guarding the entrance.
Mobiles.Description:
He is an expert warrior who has attained knighthood through countless
chivalrous deeds.  His duty is to protect the Guild of Swordsmen and his
extreme skill combined with his experience in warfare makes him a deadly
opponent.

Mobiles.Name: bartender
Mobiles.Long_Description: A bartender watches you calmly, while he skillfully mixes a drink.
Mobiles.Description: A tired looking Bartender who hates trouble in his bar.

Mobiles.Name: waiter
Mobiles.Long_Description: A waiter is going around from one place to another.
Mobiles.Description: A tired looking waiter.

Mobiles.Name: waiter
Mobiles.Long_Description:
A man who in his young days was a famous sorcerer but now leads a quiet,
peaceful life as a waiter.

Mobiles.Name: waiter
Mobiles.Long_Description: A waiter who seems to have reached contact with God.

Mobiles.Name: waiter
Mobiles.Long_Description: A waiter who knows where all his customers keep their money.

Mobiles.Name: waiter
Mobiles.Long_Description: A waiter who easily could kill you, and still carry quite a few firebreathers.

Mobiles.Name: filthy
Mobiles.Long_Description: Filthy is standing here, eager to serve you a special drink.
Mobiles.Description:
Filthy looks real, ehm, dirty. He likes to keep his costumers happy,
but do not mess with him or else he'll get upset.

Mobiles.Name: dealer
Mobiles.Long_Description: Aod the Dealer stands in the shadows here.
Mobiles.Description:
Aod looks just like the dealer hoodlum you see on T.V.  He's wearing a
concert shirt and Levi 501's.  His hair is pulled back into a pony tail.
A beard and moustache complete the look.  Aod has brought some drugs
with him from Generic Mud.
<worn on penis>      A Trojan (TM) Condom.

Since he practices safe sex,

Mobiles.Name: cityguard guard
Mobiles.Long_Description: A cityguard stands here.
Mobiles.Description: A big, strong, helpful, trustworthy guard.

Mobiles.Name: janitor
Mobiles.Long_Description: A janitor is walking around, cleaning up.

Mobiles.Name: fido dog
Mobiles.Long_Description: Beastly Fido is here.
Mobiles.Description:
Fido is a small dog that has a foul smell and pieces of rotted meat hanging
around his teeth.

Mobiles.Name: vagabond
Mobiles.Long_Description: A vagabond is here, looking for victims.
Mobiles.Description: He looks pretty mean.

Mobiles.Name: drunk
Mobiles.Long_Description: A singing, happy drunk.
Mobiles.Description: A drunk who seems to be too happy, and to carry too much money.

Mobiles.Name: beggar
Mobiles.Long_Description: A beggar is here, asking for a few coins.
Mobiles.Description: The beggar looks like she is fed up with life.

Mobiles.Name: cat
Mobiles.Long_Description: An alley cat hisses at you.
Mobiles.Description: The alley cat is half starved and more than a little feral.

Mobiles.Name: cityguard guard
Mobiles.Long_Description: A cityguard is here, guarding the gate.
Mobiles.Description: A big, strong, helpful, trustworthy guard.

Mobiles.Name: cityguard guard
Mobiles.Long_Description: A cityguard is here, guarding the gate.
Mobiles.Description: A big, strong, helpful, trustworthy guard.

Mobiles.Name: cityguard guard
Mobiles.Long_Description: A cityguard is here, guarding the mayor.
Mobiles.Description: A big, strong, helpful, trustworthy guard.

Objects.Name: jerkin scale mail
Objects.Description: A scale mail jerkin is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: coif scale mail
Objects.Description: A scale mail coif is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: skirt scale mail
Objects.Description: A long scale mail skirt is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: boots reinforced
Objects.Description: A pair of reinforced boots lies here.

Objects.Name: gloves reinforced
Objects.Description: A pair of reinforced gloves is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: sleeves scale mail
Objects.Short_Description: a pair of scale mail sleeves
Objects.Description: A pair of scale mail sleeves is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: shield small metal
Objects.Description: A small metal shield is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: tea cup
Objects.Description: A cup has been set here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: It is a small simple cup.

Objects.Name: coffee cup
Objects.Description: A cup has been set here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: It is a small simple cup.

Objects.Name: water cup
Objects.Description: A cup has been set here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: It is a large simple cup.

Objects.Name: bracer bronze
Objects.Description: A bronze bracer is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: bracer iron
Objects.Description: An iron bracer is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: key iron
Objects.Description: An iron key has been left here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The iron key is not special.

Objects.Name: key rusty
Objects.Description: A rusty key has been left here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The key is a fairly large rusty key.  You notice some fresh dirt on it.

Objects.Name: key wooden
Objects.Description: A wooden key has been left here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The wooden key is not special.

Objects.Name: key brass
Objects.Description: A brass key has been left here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The brass key is small and looks like it fits a very complicated lock.

Objects.Name: sword long
Objects.Description: A long sword has been left here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: This is the ceremonial sword of the Mayor of Midgaard.

Objects.Name: hand cuffs
Objects.Description: A pair of hand cuffs has been left here.

Objects.Name: desk drawer
Objects.Description: A desk is set against the western wall.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: You notice a keyhole in the drawer.

Objects.Name: safe
Objects.Description: A safe is placed in a dark corner of the room.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The safe is very heavy.

Objects.Name: gold coins
Objects.Description: A lot of gold is here.

Objects.Name: city key
Objects.Description: The very big City Key is lying here.

Objects.Name: bench
Objects.Description: A white-painted wooden bench is standing here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
It is a quite heavy but very comfortable bench.  It is placed with its front
towards the river so you can sit and watch the river and the houses on the
other side.

Objects.Name: fountain water
Objects.Description: A small white fountain gushes forth here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: It is very nice.  Made from fine white marble.

Objects.Name: coins gold
Objects.Short_Description: a small pile of gold coins
Objects.Description: A small pile of gold coins lies here.

Objects.Name: key steel
Objects.Description: A large steel key has been left here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: A key of this size must fit a very strong lock.

Objects.Name: skin water buffalo
Objects.Description: A bloated dead buffalo is on the floor.

Objects.Name: letter resignation
Objects.Description: The receptionist's letter of resignation is taped to the wall.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The letter is written in a bold and feminine Carolinian hand.

    To whom it may concern,

        Merc Industries has installed a new no-rent save and quit
        system.  Apparently one can now save and quit at any time
        from anywhere inside a town or out.  My services here are
        no longer required.

    Diana the Receptionist

Objects.Name: notice liquidation bank
Objects.Description: The bank's notice of liquidation is taped to the wall.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The letter is written in a reserved and dignified Spencer hand.

    To whom it may concern,

        Merc Industries has charmed your money.  Apparently one's
        gold will remain close, even beyond death. We are closing
        down our offices and ATM machines.  Our services here are
        no longer required.

    Midgaard City Bank

Objects.Name: sword
Objects.Description: You see a standard issue sword here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You see a sword of great craftsmanship.  Imprinted on the side is:
Merc Industries

Objects.Name: dagger
Objects.Description: You see a standard issue dagger here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You see a dagger of great craftsmanship.  Imprinted on the side is:
Merc Industries

Objects.Name: mace
Objects.Description: You see a standard issue mace here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You see a mace of great craftsmanship.  Imprinted on the side is:
Merc Industries

Objects.Name: vest
Objects.Description: You see a standard issue vest here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You see a vest of great craftsmanship.  Stamped on the side is:
Merc Industries

Objects.Name: shield
Objects.Description: You see a standard issue shield here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You see a shield of great craftsmanship.  Imprinted on the side is:
Merc Industries

Objects.Name: cloak
Objects.Description: You see a standard issue cloak here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You see a cloak of great craftsmanship.  Imprinted on the side is:
Merc Industries

Objects.Name: helmet
Objects.Description: You see a standard issue helmet here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You see a helmet of great craftsmanship.  Imprinted on the side is:
Merc Industries

Objects.Name: leggings
Objects.Short_Description: a pair of standard issue leggings
Objects.Description: You see a pair of standard issue leggings here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You see leggings of great craftsmanship.  Imprinted on the side is:
Merc Industries

Objects.Name: boots
Objects.Short_Description: a pair of standard issue boots
Objects.Description: You see a pair of standard issue boots here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You see boots of great craftsmanship.  Imprinted on the side is:
Merc Industries

Objects.Name: gloves
Objects.Short_Description: a pair of standard issue gloves
Objects.Description: You see a pair of standard issue gloves here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You see gloves of great craftsmanship.  Imprinted on the side is:
Merc Industries

Objects.Name: sleeves
Objects.Short_Description: a pair of standard issue sleeves
Objects.Description: You see a pair of standard issue sleeves here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You see sleeves of great craftsmanship.  Imprinted on the side is:
Merc Industries

Objects.Name: cape
Objects.Description: You see a standard issue cape here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You see a cape of great craftsmanship.  Imprinted on the side is:
Merc Industries

Objects.Name: belt
Objects.Description: You see a standard issue belt here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You see a belt of great craftsmanship.  Imprinted on the side is:
Merc Industries

Objects.Name: bracer
Objects.Description: You see a standard issue bracer here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You see a bracer of great craftsmanship.  Imprinted on the side is:
Merc Industries

Objects.Name: ring signet
Objects.Description: You see a ring with a strange symbol on the floor.

Objects.Name: banner
Objects.Description: A war banner is on the floor here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: This is the official Merc war banner to see you through the darkest realm!

Objects.Name: ring diamond wedding
Objects.Description: Vanya's diamond wedding ring has been left here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
A slender gold band set with a marquise-cut four carat blue-white solitaire.
Inscribed on the inside of the band is: 'Your loving husband, House'.

Objects.Name: band gold wedding
Objects.Description: House's gold wedding band has been left here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: A wide, plain circle of gold inscribed: 'Your loving wife, Vanya'.

Objects.Name: barrel beer
Objects.Description: A beer barrel has been left here.

Objects.Name: bottle beer
Objects.Description: A beer bottle has been left here.

Objects.Name: bottle ale
Objects.Description: A dark bottle of ale has been left here.

Objects.Name: bottle firebreather
Objects.Description: A firebreather has been left here.

Objects.Name: bottle local
Objects.Description: A dark bottle has been left here.

Objects.Name: axe blade
Objects.Description: An executioner's axe is here waiting to possess its next user.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
It is quite heavy.  The blade is made of some metal that you can't even
spell.  The edge of the blade looks as if it could cut through anything
or anyone.

Objects.Name: potpie pot pie
Objects.Description: A big pot pie has been left here.

Objects.Name: pit
Objects.Description: A pit for sacrifices is in front of the altar.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
This is where you put money and items to help Doz expand this shrine and
convert more people to the belief of Eru our creator.

Objects.Name: dagger
Objects.Description: A dagger with a long thin blade is here.

Objects.Name: sword small
Objects.Description: A small sword lies here.

Objects.Name: sword long
Objects.Description: A long sword has been left here.

Objects.Name: torch
Objects.Description: A large torch.

Objects.Name: lantern
Objects.Description: A hooded brass lantern has been left here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: They say, "Use 'hold lantern' to activate."

It is a large and robust but somewhat battered oil lantern made from brass,
equipped with a handle to make it handy and a hood to protect its flame.
Some letters have been scratched on its bottom.

Objects.Name: bag
Objects.Description: A small bag.

Objects.Name: box
Objects.Description: A small box.

Objects.Name: scroll identify
Objects.Description: A scroll has carelessly been left here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The scroll has a magic formula drawn upon it:
     ???
    ?   ?
       ?
      ?
      ?
      *

Objects.Name: potion yellow
Objects.Short_Description: a yellow potion of see invisible
Objects.Description: A small yellow potion has carelessly been left here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The potion has a small label 'Detect The Invisible'.

Objects.Name: scroll recall
Objects.Description: A scroll has carelessly been left here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The scroll has written a formulae of 'Word of Recall' upon it.

Objects.Name: jacket scale mail
Objects.Description: A scale mail jacket is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: bronze breast plate
Objects.Description: A bronze breast plate is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: raft
Objects.Description: A raft has been left here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The raft looks very primitive.

Objects.Name: canoe
Objects.Description: A canoe has been left here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The canoe is fairly light.

Objects.Name: jerkin
Objects.Description: A leather jerkin is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: cap
Objects.Description: A leather cap is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: pants
Objects.Description: A pair of leather pants is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: boots
Objects.Description: A pair of leather boots lies here.

Objects.Name: gloves
Objects.Description: A pair of leather gloves is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: sleeves
Objects.Description: A pair of leather sleeves is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: jerkin
Objects.Description: A studded leather jerkin is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: cap
Objects.Description: A hard leather cap is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: pants
Objects.Short_Description: a pair of studded leather pants
Objects.Description: A pair of studded leather pants is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: boots
Objects.Short_Description: a pair of hard leather boots
Objects.Description: A pair of hard leather boots lies here.

Objects.Name: gloves
Objects.Short_Description: a pair of hard leather gloves
Objects.Description: A pair of hard leather gloves is lying on the ground.

Objects.Name: sleeves
Objects.Short_Description: a pair of studded leather sleeves
Objects.Description: A pair of studded leather sleeves is lying on the ground.

Rooms.Name: Northwest end of Concourse
Rooms.Description:
You are at the concourse, the city wall is just west.  A small promenade
goes east, and the bridge is just north of here.  The concourse continues
south along the city wall.

Rooms.Name: Promenade
Rooms.Description:
The river gently flows west just north of here.  The promenade continues
further east and to the west you see the city wall.  Park Road leads south
from here.

Rooms.Name: Promenade
Rooms.Description:
The river gently flows west just north of here.  The promenade continues
both east and west.  South of here you see the entrance to the park, and a
small building seems to be just west of the entrance.

Rooms.Name: Promenade
Rooms.Description:
The river gently flows west just north of here.  The promenade continues
both east and west.  A small path leads south.  Looking across the river you
see the levee.

Rooms.Name: Northeast end of Concourse
Rooms.Description:
You are at the Concourse.  The city wall is just east and a small
promenade goes west.  Looking across the river you see a building that
resembles a warehouse.  The Concourse continues south along the city wall.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

Rooms.Name: Park Entrance
Rooms.Description:
You are standing just inside the small park of Midgaard.  To the north is
the promenade and a small path leads south into the park.  To your east is
the famous Park Cafe.

Rooms.Name: Park Cafe
Rooms.Description:
You are inside Park Cafe, a very well lighted, cosy place. The cafe
is built from large logs. Through the windows in the northern wall you
see the river, and through the southern window you see many vigorous
colorful plants.

Rooms.Name: Small path through the park
Rooms.Description:
You are walking along a small path through the park.  The path continues
south and east.

Rooms.Name: Small path in the park
Rooms.Description:
You are standing on a small path inside the park.  The park entrance is
just north of here, and Park Cafe is just east of the entrance.  The path
leads further east and west.

Exits.Description: You see the northern park entrance.

Rooms.Name: Small path in the park
Rooms.Description:
You are on a small path running through the park.  It continues west and
south and just north of here you see the southern wall of Park Cafe.

Rooms.Name: Cityguard Head Quarters
Rooms.Description:
You are inside a tidy office.  A big desk made from dark wood is standing
in the centre of the room.

Exits.Description: You see a sign saying 'KEEP OUT'.

Rooms.Name: Park Road
Rooms.Description:
The road continues north and south.  A building is just west of here, you
notice a sign on the door.  The park entrance is to the east.

Exits.Description: You see the cityguard head quarters.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The sign on the door says:-

                 Cityguard Head Quarters

Rooms.Name: Western Park Entrance
Rooms.Description:
You are standing at the western end of the park.  A small path leads east
into the park and going west through the entrance you will reach Park Road.

Rooms.Name: A path in the park
Rooms.Description:
You are in the park.  The paths lead north and west.  Westwards is the
park entrance and to the east you see a small pond.

Exits.Description: You see the western park entrance.

Rooms.Name: The Pond
Rooms.Description:
You are swimming around in the pond, feeling rather stupid.  You can get
back on the path from the eastern and western end of the pond.

Rooms.Name: A path in the park
Rooms.Description:
You are in the park.  The paths lead north and east.  Eastwards is the
park entrance and to the west you see a small pond.

Rooms.Name: Eastern Park Entrance
Rooms.Description:
You are standing at the eastern end of the park.  A small path leads west
into the park.  Going east through the entrance you will reach Emerald
Avenue.

Rooms.Name: Emerald Avenue
Rooms.Description:
You are at Emerald Avenue which continues north and south.  To the west is
the park entrance and to the east is the not very big Town Hall of Midgaard.

Rooms.Name: Park Road
Rooms.Description: You are on Park Road which leads north and south.

Rooms.Name: Emerald Avenue
Rooms.Description: You are standing at a bend on Emerald Avenue.  The road leads north and west.

Rooms.Name: Road Crossing
Rooms.Description:
You are in the middle of the road cross.  Roads lead in all directions.
A huge black iron chain as thick as a tree trunk is fastened into the ground
at the centre of the road cross.  Its other end leads directly upwards towards
the sky.
A road sign is here.

Exits.Description: The chain disappears in the clouds.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The the chain reaches the clouds high above you.  It must take some really
powerful magic to hold such a chain in place.

The sign points in all directions:

   North - Emerald Avenue.
   East  - Park Road.
   South - Emerald Avenue.
   West  - Park Road.

Someone has added the following with red paint:

   Up    - Redferne's Flying Citadel.

Rooms.Name: Emerald Avenue
Rooms.Description:
You are standing at a bend on Emerald Avenue.  The road leads south and
east.

Rooms.Name: Park Road
Rooms.Description:
You are on Park Road which leads south and north.  Elm Stredt is east of
here.

Rooms.Name: Elm Street
Rooms.Description:
You are on Elm street.  Park Road is to the west and Elm Street continues
in eastward direction.

Rooms.Name: End of Elm Street
Rooms.Description: You are at the end of Elm Street.  An old elm tree grows here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The fresh young leaves of the elm tree wave gently in the wind.

Rooms.Name: Emerald Avenue
Rooms.Description:
You are on Emerald Avenue which continues north.
The Concourse is south of here.

Rooms.Name: Park Road
Rooms.Description: You are on Park Road which continues north.  The Concourse is south of here.

Rooms.Name: On the Concourse
Rooms.Description:
You are at the southwest corner of the city wall.  The Concourse leads
both north and east.

Rooms.Name: On the Concourse
Rooms.Description:
The Concourse continues both east and west.  Emerald Avenue is north of
here.

Rooms.Name: On the Concourse
Rooms.Description:
The Concourse continues both east and west.  Park Road is north of here
and an iron grate leads south to the graveyard.
A bronze sign has been set on the wall next to the grate.

Exits.Description: Through the solid iron bars you see the graveyard.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The sign says :-

                          Graveyard of Midgaard

    Many brave adventurers have found their final resting place here.
          Please show respect and do not desecrate their tombs.
Looks heavy.

Rooms.Name: On the Concourse
Rooms.Description:
You are at the southeast corner of the city wall.  The Concourse leads
both north and west.

Rooms.Name: Park Road
Rooms.Description: You are at Park Road which continues north and south.

Rooms.Name: Emerald Avenue
Rooms.Description:
You are standing on the north end of Emerald Avenue.  To the north is the
promenade and to the east is the small street Penny Lane.

Rooms.Name: Emerald Avenue
Rooms.Description:
You are standing at a bend on Emerald Avenue.  To the east the road goes on
and to the south is the Road Crossing.

Rooms.Name: Emerald Avenue
Rooms.Description:
You are standing at a bend on Emerald Avenue.  To the west the road goes on
and to the north is the Road Crossing.

Rooms.Name: Park Road
Rooms.Description:
You are at a bend on Park Road.  To the north the road goes on and to the
east is the Road Crossing.  To the south, the ancient cliffs rise from deep
under the ground, forming a wall.

Rooms.Name: Park Road
Rooms.Description:
You are at a bend on Park Road.  To the south the road goes on and to the
west is the Road Crossing.

Rooms.Name: The Waiting Room
Rooms.Description:
You are standing in the waiting room at the town hall.  Wooden chairs stand
along the walls and a long desk is placed in the middle of the room.

Exits.Description: It looks like some kind of office.
The exit west leads to Emerald Avenue.

Rooms.Name: The Mayor's Office
Rooms.Description:
You are in the not very big office of the Mayor of Midgaard.  A large and
polished but completely empty desk is standing in front of an armchair that
looks so comfortable that it most of all resembles a bed with the head end
raised slightly.

Exits.Description: The waiting room is to the west.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
This chair is really a masterpiece.  A chair where one can sit as comfortably
as in a bed.  All lecture halls should be equipped with these things.

Rooms.Name: Penny Lane
Rooms.Description:
You are on Penny Lane.  Emerald Avenue is to the west and Penny Lane
continues in eastward direction.

Rooms.Name: Penny Lane
Rooms.Description: You are on Penny Lane.  The narrow road continues north and west.

Rooms.Name: End of Penny Lane
Rooms.Description: You are at the end of Penny Lane.  The only exit appears to be south.

Rooms.Name: Captain's Office
Rooms.Description:
You are in the Office of the Captain of the Guard.  The Midgaard Coat of
Arms is hanging on the north wall and a heavy steel door is to the south.

Exits.Description: You see the Cityguard Head Quarters.
You see the heavy steel door.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: Although a bit dusty the Coat of Arms is an excellent piece of work.

Rooms.Name: The Jail
Rooms.Description:
You are in a dark and humid jail.  The dark stone walls are hard and cold
to the touch.  A heavy steel door is to the north.

Exits.Description: You see the heavy steel door.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The walls are marked with lots of scratches.  Some of them spell sentences
like "JAIL IS BETTER THAN SQL" and "INGRES STRIKES AGAIN".

Rooms.Name: Under the Bridge
Rooms.Description:
The arch under the bridge is covered by seaweed for one foot above the
surface of the river.  The water gently flows through an opening in the lower
part of the city wall.

Exits.Description: You see the river flowing west into the Forest of Haon-Dor.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  Looks pretty solid.

Rooms.Name: On the River
Rooms.Description:
North of here you see the miserable buildings of the poor alley.  The
river flows west towards the bridge.  The riverbanks are too steep to climb.

Rooms.Name: On the River
Rooms.Description:
North of here you see the dump.  The river flows from east to west.  The
riverbanks are too steep to climb.

Rooms.Name: On the River
Rooms.Description:
The levee is directly north of here.  The river flows in an east west
direction.

Rooms.Name: On the River
Rooms.Description:
You see the warehouse on the northern riverbank.  East of here you see the
city wall.  The river flows west towards the levee.

Rooms.Name: On the River
Rooms.Description:
The river enters from a hole in the eastern city wall.  The hole has been
blocked by several vertically positioned iron bars set into the wall.

Exits.Description:
The iron bars are broken, allowing passage through the hole in the wall.
Beyond the bars you see a dark tunnel.

Rooms.Name: The Bank
Rooms.Description:
You find yourself in the bank, here you can deposit money and withdraw
money. And any money you leave in the bank will be kept safe. At a small cost.

Rooms.Name: The Donation Room
Rooms.Description:
You are in a large room that is some sort of storage room, the intended
use is for storing unwanted equipment and weapons. This could be very
handy for people new to this world, as it is an easy way to pick up good
equipment without having to travel too far.

Rooms.Name: The Temple Of Midgaard
Rooms.Description:
You are in the southern end of the temple hall in the Temple of Midgaard.
The temple has been constructed from giant marble blocks, eternal in
appearance, and most of the walls are covered by ancient wall paintings
picturing Gods, Giants and peasants.
		The Temple lies to the north and the centre of Midgaard to the south.
NEWBIES : say 'take me home' to travel back to the safety of the newbie zone.

Exits.Description: At the northern end of the temple hall is a statue and a huge altar.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
This entire world has been integrated, modified, debugged, and enhanced by
Hatchet, Kahn, and Furey of MERC Industries to be run by any MERC Mud.
1992 December 17

RoomText_Data.Output:
$n's body flickers with red energy.
$n disappears!
RoomText_Data.Name: all

Rooms.Name: Cleric's Inner Sanctum
Rooms.Description:
This is the inner sanctum.  A picture of the mighty Thor, is hanging on
the wall, just above the altar which is set against the western wall.  A well
in the middle of the floor leads down into darkness.  Vile smells waft from
the depths.

Exits.Description: You see your favorite place, the bar of divination.

You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.

Rooms.Name: Cleric's Bar
Rooms.Description:
The bar is one of the finest in the land, lucky it is members only.  Fine
furniture is set all around the room.  A small sign is hanging on the wall.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the waiter:

   Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the waiter.
   List - The waiter will show you all the different drinks and
          specialties, and tell the price of each.

Rooms.Name: Entrance to Cleric's Guild
Rooms.Description:
The entrance hall is a small modest room, reflecting the true nature of
the Clerics.  The exit leads east to the temple square.  A small entrance to
the bar is in the northern wall.

Exits.Description: You see the bar, richly decorated with really stylish furniture.

Rooms.Name: The Temple Square
Rooms.Description:
You are standing on the temple square.  Huge marble steps lead up to the
temple gate.  The entrance to the Clerics Guild is to the west, and the old
Grunting Boar Inn, is to the east.  Just south of here you see the market
square, the center of Midgaard.

Exits.Description: You see the good old Grunting Boar Inn.
You see the entrance to the Clerics Guild.

Rooms.Name: Entrance to the Grunting Boar Inn
Rooms.Description:
You are standing in the entrance hall of the Grunting Boar Inn.  The hall
has been wisely decorated with simple but functional furniture.  A small
staircase leads up to the defunct reception room and the bar is to the east.

Exits.Description: You see the defunct reception room.

Rooms.Name: The Grunting Boar
Rooms.Description:
You are standing in the bar.  The bar is set against the northern wall, old
archaic writing, carvings and symbols cover its top.  A fireplace is built into
the western wall, and through the southeastern windows you can see the temple
square.  This place makes you feel like home.
A small sign with big letters is fastened to the bar.

Exits.Description: You see the exit to the entrance hall.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
Although it is very hard to understand, you think it looks a lot like beer,
poems about beer, and small beer-mugs.

The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the Grunting Boar Inn.

   Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the bartender.
   List - The bartender will show you all the different drinks and
          specialties, and tell the price of each.

Rooms.Name: The Defunct Reception
Rooms.Description:
You are standing in a dusty, defunct reception.  The staircase leads
down to the entrance hall.

Rooms.Name: The Bakery
Rooms.Description:
You are standing inside the small bakery.  A sweet scent of Danish and
fine bread fills the room.  The bread and Danish are arranged in fine order
on the shelves, and seem to be of the finest quality.
A small sign is on the counter.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
Free instructions provided by the store:

   Buy  - Will buy you some bread or pastry.
   List - The baker will kindly tell you the price and sort of the bread in
          his bakery.

You see that this is truly delicious pastry.  Must be made by a Dane from
Denmark (which surely is not the capital of Sweden!).  Former ruler of
Scandinavia, England, Northern Germany, Northern France, Russia, Greenland,
Iceland, Estonia etc. etc.
   The sight of those large, wholesome chokoladeboller makes your mouth water
and your soul sing.

Rooms.Name: The General Store
Rooms.Description:
You are inside the general store.  All sorts of items are stacked on shelves
behind the counter, safely out of your reach.
A small note hangs on the wall.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The note reads:

  List  - Show which various items are in the store.
  Buy   - Buy an item.
  Value - The shopkeeper will (free of charge) tell how much he will
          pay for your item.
  Sell  - Sell an item.

Rooms.Name: The Weapon Shop
Rooms.Description: You are inside the weapon shop.  There is a small note on the counter.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The note reads:

  List  - Show which various items are in the store.
  Buy   - Buy an item.
  Value - The shopkeeper will (free of charge) tell how much he will
          pay for your item.
  Sell  - Sell an item.

Rooms.Name: Main Street
Rooms.Description:
You are at the end of the main street of Midgaard.  South of here is the
entrance to the Guild of Magic Users.  The street continues east towards the
market square.  The magic shop is to the north and to the west is the city
gate.

Exits.Description: You see the entrance to the Guild of Magic Users.

Rooms.Name: Main Street
Rooms.Description:
You are on the main street passing through the City of Midgaard.  South of
here is the entrance to the Armoury, and the bakery is to the north.  East of
here is the market square.

Rooms.Name: Market Square
Rooms.Description:
You are standing on the market square, the famous Square of Midgaard.
A large, peculiar looking statue is standing in the middle of the square.
Roads lead in every direction, north to the temple square, south to the
common square, east and westbound is the main street.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: What you see is the Midgaard Worm, stretching around the Palace of Midgaard.

Rooms.Name: The Main Street
Rooms.Description:
You are on Main Street crossing through town.  To the north is the general
store, and the main street continues east.  To the west you see and hear the
market place and to the south is the Jeweller's Shop.

Rooms.Name: The Main Street
Rooms.Description:
The main street, to the north is the weapon shop and to the south is the
Guild of Swordsmen.  To the east you leave town and to the west the street
leads to the market square.

Exits.Description: You see the main street leading to the market square.

Rooms.Name: Entrance to Mage's Guild
Rooms.Description: The entrance hall is a small, poor lighted room.

Exits.Description: You see your favorite place, the Mage's Bar.

Rooms.Name: Mage's Bar
Rooms.Description:
The bar is one of the wierdest in the land.  Mystical images float around
the air.  Illusions of fine furniture appear all around the room.

Rooms.Name: Mage's Laboratory
Rooms.Description:
This is the Magical Experiments Laboratory.  Dark smoke-stained stones
arch over numerous huge oaken tables, most of these cluttered with strange-
looking pipes and flasks.  The floor is covered with half-erased pentagrams
and even weirder symbols, and a blackboard in a dark corner has only been
partially cleaned, some painful-looking letters faintly visible.  A well in
the middle of the floor leads down into darkness.  Vile smells waft from the
depths.

Exits.Description:
You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.

Rooms.Name: The Armoury
Rooms.Description:
The armoury with all kinds of armours on the walls and in the window.  You
see helmets, shields and chain mails.  To the north is the main street.
On the wall is a small note.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You can use these commands for trading:

  value <item>     To get the price of an item in your possession.
  sell <item>      To sell something.
  buy <item>       To buy something (provided that the shop has it in store).
  list             Gives you a listing of the shop's inventory.

        WE DON'T GIVE CREDIT; WE DON'T EXPECT TO RECEIVE CREDIT!
                             NO HAGGLING

Rooms.Name: Entrance Hall to the Guild of Swordsmen
Rooms.Description:
The entrance hall to the Guild of Swordsmen.  A place where one has to be
careful not to say something wrong (or right).  To the east is the bar and to
the north is the main street.

Exits.Description: You see the swordsmen's bar, many noises comes from there.

Rooms.Name: The Bar of Swordsmen
Rooms.Description:
The bar of swordsmen, once upon a time beautifully furnished.  But now the
furniture is all around you in small pieces.  To the south is the yard, and
to the west is the entrance hall.

Exits.Description: You see the entrance hall to the thieves guild.

Rooms.Name: The Tournament and Practice Yard
Rooms.Description:
The practice yard of the fighters.  To the north is the bar.  A well leads
down into darkness.

Exits.Description:
You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.

Rooms.Name: Eastern End of Poor Alley
Rooms.Description:
You are at the poor alley.  South of here is the Grubby Inn and to the
east you see common square.  The alley continues further west.

Rooms.Name: The Common Square
Rooms.Description:
The common square, people pass you, talking to each other.  To the west is
the poor alley and to the east is the dark alley.  To the north, this square
is connected to the market square.  From the south you notice a nasty smell.

Rooms.Name: The Dark Alley
Rooms.Description:
The dark alley, to the west is the common square and to the south is the
Guild of Thieves.  The alley continues east.

Exits.Description: You see the entrance to the thieves guild.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: It is the thieves guild, don't enter if you care about your health or money.

Rooms.Name: Entrance Hall to the Guild of Thieves
Rooms.Description:
The entrance hall to the thieves' and assassins' guild.  A place where you
can lose both your life and your money, if you are not careful.  To the north
is the dark alley and to the east is the thieves' bar.

Exits.Description: You see the thieves bar, where everything disappears.

Rooms.Name: The Thieves Bar
Rooms.Description:
The bar of the thieves.  Once upon a time this place was beautifully
furnished, but now it seems almost empty.  To the south is the yard, and to
the west is the entrance hall.
   (Maybe the furniture has been stolen?!)

Exits.Description: You see the entrance hall to the thieves guild.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: As you look at the furniture, the chair you sit on disappears.

Rooms.Name: The Secret Yard
Rooms.Description:
The secret practice yard of thieves and assassins.  To the north is the
bar.  A well leads down into darkness.

Exits.Description:
You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.

Rooms.Name: The Dump
Rooms.Description:
The dump, where the people from the city drop their garbage.  Through the
garbage you can see a large junction of pipes, looks like the entrance to the
sewer system.  South of here you see the river and to the north is the common
square.

Exits.Description:
You see the river slowly flowing west, but notice that it would be nearly
impossible to reach the river due to all the garbage and a steep river
bank.

Rooms.Name: The Pet Shop
Rooms.Description:
The Pet Shop is a small crowded store, full of cages and animals of
various sorts and sizes.  There is a sign on the wall.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The sign reads:

  Use 'List' to see the available pets.
  Use 'Buy <pet> <name>' to buy yourself a pet and name it.

  You can use 'order <pet> <instructions>' to order your pets around.
  If you abuse your pet, it will no longer regard you as its master.
  If you have several pets you may use 'order all <instructions>'

 Regards,

   The Shopkeeper

Rooms.Name: Pet Shop Store
Rooms.Description:
This is the small dark room in which the Pet Shop Boy keeps his pets.
It is vital that this room be immediately after the pet shop.

Rooms.Name: The Magic Shop
Rooms.Description:
You are in a small room that smells of rare chemicals and spices.
Dividing the room in two is a large desk, and on the wall behind it are
numerous shelves crammed with jars, bottles, books and scrolls of all
sorts and sizes.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: Each scroll is stored in a leather tube that protects it from moist.
Most of them appear to be very old and dusty.

Some of them are transparent enabling you to see that some contain colored
powders while others contain body parts of various animals.

Rooms.Name: The Jeweller's Shop
Rooms.Description:
You are in a small, beautifully furnished room.  The warm light emanating
from the small oil lamps on the walls is reflected in the hard, polished
surface of the big mahogany desk that stands in the centre of the room.
A small sign with golden letters stands on the desk.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The golden letters say :-

    Use 'list' to see what is in store,
        'buy <item>' to buy an item,
        'sell <item>' to sell an item and
        'value <item>' to make the jeweller evaluate an item.
Your face is reflected in its surface.

They are made from polished gold and looks as if they are securely fastened
to the smooth stone walls.

Rooms.Name: The Leather Shop
Rooms.Description:
An acrid smell fills this large room.  Along the walls are numerous
shelves containing all sorts of animal hide and in the crackling fireplace
hangs a big iron pot with boiling water.  In the middle of the room is a
large oak table.
A wooden sign is hanging above the fireplace.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The wooden sign says :-

    Use 'list' to see what is in store,
        'buy <item>' to buy an item,
        'sell <item>' to sell an item and
        'value <item>' to make the leather worker evaluate an item.
Several large pieces of leather hide are boiling in the iron pot.

It is made from solid oak but appears to be very used.  Its surface is
covered in marks and scratches.  A large burning candle stands directly on
the table surface, tallow flowing down its sides.
It is a rather large fireplace made from heavy granite rocks.

Rooms.Name: Inside the West Gate of Midgaard
Rooms.Description:
You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and
connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.  Main Street leads
east and Wall Road leads south from here.

Exits.Description: You see a Dimly Lit Path.

You see the road running along the inner side of the city wall.  You notice
that it is called Wall Road.
The city gate is to the west.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.

It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.

Rooms.Name: Inside the East Gate of Midgaard
Rooms.Description:
You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and
connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.  Main Street leads
west from here.  South of here is the wall road, but it looks dirty and 
not too safe.

Exits.Description: You see the slums of Midgaard.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.

It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.

Rooms.Name: Wall Road
Rooms.Description:
You are walking next to the western city wall.  The road continues further
south and the city gate is just north of here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

Rooms.Name: Wall Road
Rooms.Description:
You are walking next to the western city wall.  Wall Road continues further
north and south.  A small, poor alley leads east.
Some letters have been written on the wall here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
It says 'Who watches the watchmen?'

Rooms.Name: Poor Alley
Rooms.Description:
You are in narrow and dirty alley leading east and west.  The leather shop
is to the north.

Exits.Description: The leather shop is to the north.

Rooms.Name: Alley at Levee
Rooms.Description:
You are standing in the alley which continues east and west.  South of
here you see the levee.  North is the Pet Shop.

Exits.Description: You see, hear, and smell the pet shop.

Rooms.Name: Eastern end of Alley
Rooms.Description:
You are standing at the eastern end of the alley.  An old three-story
warehouse is directly south of here, and the Mob Factory is east.

Exits.Description: The entrance to the Mob Factory lies east.

Rooms.Name: Wall Road
Rooms.Description:
You are standing on the road next to the western city wall which
continues north.  South of here is a bridge across the river.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

Rooms.Name: Grubby Inn
Rooms.Description:
You are inside the old Grubby Inn.  This place has not been cleaned for
several decades, vile smells make you dizzy.

Rooms.Name: Levee
Rooms.Description:
You are at the levee.  South of here you see the river gently flowing west.
The river bank is very low making it possible to enter the river.

Exits.Description: You see the river flowing west.

Rooms.Name: Abandoned Warehouse
Rooms.Description:
You are inside the only room in the old warehouse.  The place is very dusty
and appears to have been unused for many years.  The skylight spills
violet-tinged light.

Exits.Description: You see machine dreams and taste violet phosphor.

Rooms.Name: On the Bridge
Rooms.Description:
You are standing on the stone bridge crosses the river.  The bridge is
built out from the western city wall and the river flows west through an
opening in the wall ten feet below the bridge.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
You cannot really see it from here as it is somewhere beneath your feet.

It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar, just like the wall.

Rooms.Name: Outside the West Gate of Midgaard
Rooms.Description:
You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and
connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.  To the west you
can see the edge of a big forest. A small dusty trail leads north along the
wall.

Exits.Description: The trail continues around the City of Midgaard.
The city gate is to the east.
The forest edge is to the west.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.

It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.

Rooms.Name: Outside the East Gate of Midgaard
Rooms.Description:
You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and
connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.  To the east the
plains stretch out in the distance. To the north a small dusty trail follow
the city wall.

Exits.Description: The trail contintes around the City of Midgaard.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.

It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.

Rooms.Name: By the Temple Altar
Rooms.Description:
You are by the temple altar in the northern end of the Temple of Midgaard.
A huge altar made from white polished marble is standing in front of you and
behind it is a ten foot tall sitting statue of Odin, the King of the Gods.

Exits.Description: You see the southern end of the temple.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The statue represents the one-eyed Odin sitting on a his throne.  He has
long, grey hair and beard and a strict look on his face.  On top of the
throne, just above his shoulders, his two ravens Hugin and Munin are sitting
and at his feet are his wolves Gere and Freke.

Even though the altar is more than ten feet long it appears to be made from a
single block of white virgin marble.

Rooms.Name: In the air...
Rooms.Description: WOW you can fly!  You are floating in the air above Temple Square of Midgaard.

Exits.Description: Back down on the earth where you should be!
